paragraphs.text: Is Russia overstretching itself?
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: In 1783, Russia and the Kingdom of Kartli-Kakheti, which would later become part of modern day Republic of Georgia, signed the Treaty of Georgievsk
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Among other things this treaty gave Kartli-Kakheti a status of a Russian protectorate
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Squished between the Russian, Persian, and Ottoman Empires, this was exactly what the tiny kingdom needed
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: or
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: so they thought
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The deal with Russia soon turned deadly
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Russia reneged on the treaty, and by 1795 Russian troops had left the region
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: a Persian army had invaded and leveled the capital city of Tbilisi
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Georgians have never forgotten this betrayal
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: When
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Soviet Russia marked the bicentenary of the Treaty of Georgievsk in 1983
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: it was met with mass protests from anti-Soviet Georgians
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The Treaty of Georgievsk might have been the first dodgy treaty Russia signed in the region
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it certainly has not been the last
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Soon Russia is expected to sign a treaty with Georgia's breakaway province South Ossetia
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Last November, Russia and Abkhazia - another breakaway province in Georgia - signed a treaty on "alliance and strategic partnership"
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: This treaty established a coordinated foreign policy, the creation of a "common security and defense space" between Russia and Abkhazia, and the implementation of a streamlined process for Abkhazians to receive Russian citizenship
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The pending treaty with South Ossetia is expected to bring the relationship between South Ossetia and Russia even closer
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: While
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Abkhaz officials have shown little interest in getting annexed by Russia
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: many in South Ossetia would be happy with this outcome
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The defacto leader of South Ossetia Leonid Tibilov said the treaty could see the tiny breakaway province"becoming a subject of the Russian Federation"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: The Ossetian people are representative of the typical geographical, religious, and ethnic complexities found in the Caucasus
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Ethically and linguistically they are descended from Iranians
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Religiously they are Orthodox Christian
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The Ossetian people are unique in the Caucasus
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: as
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: they are the only ethnic group found living in large numbers on both sides of the mountains
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Even so
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: South Ossetia does not have close links to Russia's North Ossetia
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: as one might expect
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The only road linking the two Ossetias runs through the Roki tunnel
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: which was only completed in 1984
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: In fact
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Tskhinvali, the administrative capital of South Ossetia, is closer to Tbilisi than it is to North Ossetia's capital city Vladikavkaz
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Since the 2008 Russian invasion of Georgia, Russia has occupied South Ossetia with thousands of troops
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Almost seven years on, Russia is still in direct violation of the Six Point Ceasefire Agreement brokered by then-French President Nicolas Sarkozy
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Russia has spent millions of dollars building a fence around the administrative boundary between South Ossetia and Georgia
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: In some cases, the fence cuts homes, families, and properties into half
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Russia is one of only four countries that recognise South Ossetia's independence (the others being Venezuela, Nicaragua, and Nauru)
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: By contrast, many European countries and the United States recognise the Russian presence in South Ossetia as an illegal occupation
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Russia needs to think carefully before annexing South Ossetia
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: As
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Moscow has experienced with Crimea
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: annexation comes at a cost, both economically and geo-politically
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Economic sanctions are starting to bite
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: the ruble is down
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the low price of oil is severely impacting the Russian economy
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Then there are all the other costs associated with annexation: paying for pensions, local services, healthcare, education, and infrastructure
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: this is a heavy burden for the stagnate Russian economy
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The Georgian Foreign Ministry criticised Russia's move as a step toward "annexation of Georgia's occupied territories"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: In reality, there is little Georgia can do about it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Raising international awareness and encouraging the US and Europe to link economic sanctions connected to Russia's annexation of Crimea to any possible annexation of South Ossetia is the first thing the Georgian government should do
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The history of the Caucasus has shown that allegiances have, and can, change over time
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Through a long term process of confidence building measures, the Georgian government needs to show those in South Ossetia that their future is brighter with Tbilisi and in the transatlantic community than it is with Russia
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Finally
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Georgia must stick with its "non-use of force" pledge regarding the occupied territories
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: There is no military solution to either South Ossetia or Abkhazia
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the region can hardly afford another war
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is ironic that since the early 1990s thousands of South Ossetians have died fighting for their independence from Georgia
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: when
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: they are likely to hand over their sovereignty to Russia
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Russia's treaties with Abkhazia and South Ossetia should be seen for what they really are: the first step in a process of Russian annexation of both breakaway regions
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: both of which are still internationally recognised to be part of Georgia
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Considering Russia's illegal annexation of Crimea, Georgians have cause for concern
paragraphs.label: assumption
